newsitem.title: ARGENTINA: ARGENTINE BLUE CHIPS ERASE LOSSES AT CLOSE.
newsitem.headline: ARGENTINE BLUE CHIPS ERASE LOSSES AT CLOSE.

text.p: Argentine blue chips clawed back into positive territory at the close Friday on short-covering, but the broad index lagged behind, still hurt by a selloff on U.S. markets, dealers said.
"New York gave us a fright today but it was a good opportunity for business here," said Nestor de Cessare of traders Allaria Ledesma.
He said the trend was likely to remain volatile next week ahead of the release of U.S. inflation data.
The blue-chip MerVal index recovered from a floor of 836.47 to close up 0.1 percent at 850.73.
The MerVal, which had closed at a five-year high of 857 Wednesday, mustered gains of 1.2 percent on the week.
"The drop in U.S. bonds was linked to the swings in the dollar currency and the effect the dollar's woes had on the Treasury's refunding effort," De Cessare said.
"We could see some more erratic movements in the long bond yield in the next few days, but locally I'd say this is just a temporary downward correction."
The broad market index recouped some losses but closed off 0.7 percent, with losers outstripping winners 33 to 19 and 12 issues closing flat.
